Articles.Content:
Hi.

I have built a 4-symmetry subassembly (basically a hollow main hull for a spaceplane) in VAB, turned it horizontal and have now attached it to a 1-symmetry command pod in SPH.

When I try to connect girder segments to the girder segments of the main hull using 2-symmetry, one side 'flickers', as though there was a double-up of the part. Also, I can't switch between 1- or 2-symmetry with 'x' like I should, not until I have deleted the part I was trying to attach.

Is this something other people have encountered? Seems to happen every time.

Thanks

EDIT: also happens with Wing connectors - basically anything added to the girder segments of the subassembly will do the same thing. The part you manually add doesn't flicker, only the other one added by the 2-symmetry.

Edited September 24, 2014 by Progressm

I think I know what you're talking about. Attachment in the SPH is kinda a mess. I belive the reason you're seeing the flickering is because the parts actually are clipping due to symmetry weirdness. Attach some pics and we'll be able to help you more.

Oh switching from VAB to SPH has caused me no end of symmetry issues in the past. I've had this where whole sections have doubled up on top of each other. I think I just started again as I couldn't unattach the root part anymore (complete mess). I did launch for a laugh and ended up with half my craft buried at a 90degree angle in the runway, when the physics kicked in my plane just rained out of the earth.

Heh - in short, looks like switching between the assembly rooms really stuffs up symmetry, as stated above.

What does work to an extent though, is tricking the game into allowing 4-symmetry in SPH by first attaching say tail fins with 2-symmetry, then flicking the whole plane on its side and attach another pair of tail fins - turn plane back and voila, 4-symmetry tail done. It does bug out sometimes, though.
